description: The image service uses a mosaic rule to mosaick multiple rasters on the fly. The mosaic rule parameter is used by many image service operations, for example, export image and identify operations.
title: mosaicRule

___where.description: Use a where clause to define a subset of rasters used in the mosaic, be aware that the rasters may not be visible at all scales.

___dimensionName.description: Type of dimension being used (ex. StdTime).

___fids.description: A list that defines a subset of rasters used in the mosaic, be aware that the rasters may not be visible at all scales.

___itemRenderingRule.description: The rendering rule applies on items before mosaicking.

___ascending.description: Indicate whether to use ascending or descending order.

$eref.description: Defines the JSON formats of the point and spatial reference objects.
$eref.title: pointGeometry

___m.description: M coordinate which contains measures used for linear referencing.

___x.description: X coordinate which is measured along the east/west axis.

___y.description: Y coordinate which is measured along the north/south axis.

___spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

___z.description: Z coordinate which measures height or elevation.

___viewpoint.description: Use a view point along with `esriMosaicViewpoint`.

___sortValue.description: The base sort value used together with `esriMosaicAttribute` method and `sortField` parameter.

___mosaicMethod.description: A string value that determines how the selected rasters are ordered.

___lockRasterIds.description: Lock a few rasters in the image service. Used together with `esriMosaicLockRaster`.

___sortField.description: The field name used together with `esriMosaicAttribute` method.

___mosaicOperation.description: Use the mosaic operation to resolve overlap pixel values: from first or last raster, use the min, max or mean of the pixel values, or blend them.
